title: What can I do to become an astronaut after 12th passing from science? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you really want to become an Astronaut, Keep Reading. Answer has two Parts one for NASA and other for ISRO For NASA:  To do this you need to apply to NASA after your graduation. NASA chooses only few applications out of thousands for intensive Astronaut Candidate training program. NASA announces opportunity to apply for the position of Astronaut Candidate to Support International Space Station program. Every two year NASA announces for selecting about 100 men and women out of 1000 applicants. For this job a candidate has to pass Class 12th examinations under science stream especially in Physics and Mathematics And you have to go through Science stream after +2. But universities providing Astronomy Undergraduate programme are rarely found, so you can join a Bachelor’s Course in Physics with Mathematics. Then you need to take Master’s Degree in Physics. After Successful completion of you Master’s Degree you can do Ph.D which makes you eligible to become an astronomer/ astronaut/ astrophysicist or a scientist/ research officer etc. For more Information refer: http://www.nasajobs.nasa.gov/astronauts/default.htm For ISRO  You need to appear in IIST exam ( Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST) after 12th or During 12th You will get details of this exam here : Home | IIST After B.Tech: For this you have to appear for ISRO centralised recruitment. The advertisement for this is often published in national newspapers. After Post Graduation: You can also join ISRO after completing M.Sc, M Tech and Ph D. in science subjects Advertisement for such positions also given in national newspapers. I hope this helps! Also read APJ Abdul Kalam’s Wings of Fire for more motivation! If you have your friends aspiring for this career please let them know! If you like Please UpVote! All the Best!
